comments.body: Assertions can be implicit, I don't think we need to express them in the method name. How about using `staticLedgerId` instead?

IMO it is better to have it explicit, since if someone calls into this function when `ledgerId` is not static, it is a bug in the code. It is the same style as prefixing partial or dangerous functions with `unsafe`.
Ok, letâ€™s leave it. My take is that as long as we have good tests and documented behaviour this should not matter and it just makes the code less fluent/readable.
